Internal functions

Internal functions

auxfuncts.jl

GeMM.checkborderconditions — Method.
checkborderconditions!(w, x, y)

check if coordinates x and y lie within world w and correct if not, considering defined border conditions.

source
GeMM.createchrms — Method.

createchrms(nchrms, genes) Randomly distribute the passed genes into the given number of chromosomes. Returns an array of chromosome objects.

source
GeMM.creategenes — Method.

creategenes(ngenes, traits, settings) Randomly create a given number of gene objects, with their base sequence and associated traits. Returns the result as an array of AbstractGenes.

source
GeMM.createind — Function.

createind(settings, marked=false) Create an individual organism with of a new species with a random genome.

source
GeMM.createoffspring — Method.

createoffspring(noffs, individual, partner, traitnames) The main reproduction function. Take two organisms and create the given number of offspring individuals. Returns an array of individuals.

source
GeMM.createtraits — Method.

createtraits(settings) Create an array of trait objects generated from the default trait values (with a random offset).

source
GeMM.diversity — Method.
diversity(w)

Calculate (average) alpha, beta and gamma diversity of the world. Returns a tuple with the three values (a,b,g). cf. Veech et al. 2002

source
GeMM.findisland — Method.
findisland(w)

within world w, find out in which direction from the continent the island(s) lie(s).

source
GeMM.findposspartner — Method.

findposspartner(patch, individual, traitnames) Find a reproduction partner for the given individual in the given patch.

source
GeMM.freespace — Method.

freespace(world) Calculate the average amount of free space on each patch.

source
GeMM.gausscurve — Function.

gausscurve(b, c, x, a=1.0) Calculate the value of the Gauss function ("bell curve") at point x; with a being the maximum height of the curve, b the position of the curve center and c the standard deviation ("width").

source
GeMM.getmeantraitvalue — Method.

getmeantraitvalue(traits, traitidx) Take an array of traits and return the mean value of the indexed trait.

source
GeMM.getstdtraitvalue — Method.

getstdtraitvalue(traits, traitidx) Take an array of traits and return the standard deviation of the indexed trait.

source
GeMM.gettraitdict — Method.

gettraitdict(genes, traitnames) Calculate the trait dict for an array of genes.

source
GeMM.gettraitdict — Method.

gettraitdict(chromosomes, traitnames) Convert a genome (an array of chromosomes) into a dict of traits and their values.

source
GeMM.gettraitdict — Method.

gettraitdict(traits, traitnames) Construct a trait dict from a list of Trait objects.

source
GeMM.identifyAdults! — Method.

identifyAdults!(patch) Build up the whoiswho index of individuals and species in a patch.

source
GeMM.iscompatible — Method.

iscompatible(mate, individual, traitnames) Check to see whether two individual organisms are reproductively compatible.

source
GeMM.markthem! — Method.

markthem!(community) Set each individual in the community (= array of individuals) as "marked".

source
GeMM.markthem! — Method.

markthem!(world) Set every individual in the world as "marked".

source
GeMM.markthem! — Method.

markthem!(habitat) Set each individual in the given patch as "marked".

source
GeMM.meiosis — Method.

meiosis(genome, maternal) Carry out meiosis on a genome (marked as maternal or not). Returns a haploid gamete genome. (genome => array of chromosomes)

source
GeMM.num2seq — Method.
num2seq(n)

Convert an integer into binary and then into a DNA base sequence string.

source
GeMM.seq2bignum — Method.
seq2bignum(sequence)

Convert a DNA base sequence (a string) into binary and then into an BigInt (for larger genes). This saves memory.

source
GeMM.seq2num — Method.
seq2num(sequence)

Convert a DNA base sequence (a string) into binary and then into an integer. This saves memory.

source
GeMM.traitsexist — Method.

traitsexist(traits, settings) Check a trait dict to make sure it contains the full set of traitnames required by the model (as defined in the settings).

source
GeMM.traitsexist — Method.

traitsexist(individual, settings) Make sure an individual organism has the full set of traits required by the model (as defined in the settings).

source
GeMM.varyalleles! — Method.

varyalleles!(genes, settings, locivar) Mutate gene traits in the passed array of genes.

source
GeMM.varyalleles! — Method.

varyalleles!(chromosomes, settings, locivar) Mutate gene traits in the passed array of chromosomes.

source
